utterance.speaker: MOM
utterance.content: Honey? What is that?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah ha! Found it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Dad, you should toss that. It’s getting kinda gross.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Toss cookie angel? No way. You made this for me in first grade with your chubby little hands.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Darling, could you pick me up an extra bottle of aquavit for our Glögg?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An extra bottle of hundred proof? You’re not tampering with our secret holiday recipe?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no. I was going to make an extra-large batch to take with me Christmas Eve caroling. Oh, it’ll be after our Christmas dinner. You don’t mind, do you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But it’s Christmas Eve. That’s when we open the gifts.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Maybe we can open them in the morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the morning? Mornings are for stockings.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, I think – I think what Alexis is trying to say is that she has other plans, too.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Just with a couple of friends. It’s –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What friends? What plans? What is happening to our family tradition?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I think you’re kind of over reacting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am not overreacting. It’s one night out of the year. Is it too much to ask to stick to the program?

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Well maybe your program should evolve a little.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is evolving. I invited you, didn’t I? You are still coming, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, yeah, I mean, if I don’t have to work. But look, no presents, remember? We promised. It’s just … a little too stressful this first year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No presents. I’m flexible. There are certain aspects to this that are time honored. The heart, the beating heart behind the Christmas holidays. And now Santa is dead? When will it end?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I hate to break it to you Castle, but there is no Santa.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well not any more.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: You gotta admit, with that beard and that belly he looks like the real deal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If by the real deal you mean an overweight man in a red suit who is hopefully carrying ID?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. Along with lots of candy cane wrappers, though I don’t think that ID of his is going to do you much good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kris Kringle, address North Pole. That’s cute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he’s the real Santa. Like in Miracle on 34th Street.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, but with no happy ending. This Santa fell out of the sky around 9:30.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From an aircraft?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Maybe, but it wasn’t a commercial plane, I can tell you that. With a fall from high altitude we’d see severe frostbite on his eyes and his face.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so I just talked with the family. They didn’t see or hear any planes overhead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t make any sense. He had to have fallen from somewhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, are we overlooking the obvious here? He hit some turbulence and slipped out of his sleigh and fell to his doom.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Santa, lying there dead. You gotta ask yourself, what kind of world do we live in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A world in which there is no Santa and people don’t fall out of nowhere. Can you check with air traffic control and find out what flights were in the area?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sure. Bah humbug.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So was the fall cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks like it, but I won’t know for sure until I get him back to the morgue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well Santa or no, he sure is committed. And you’re saying there’s nothing in his wallet that indicated a break in character?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except for these boots. They are definitely not from the North Pole. They’re custom made from a leather shop in Queens. I got a pair of motorcycle boots there. Hopefully they’ll have a record of who this man is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, I heard from air traffic control, but you’re not going to like the news. They have no record of anyone flying over the park during the time our guy hit the ground.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How is that even possible?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Santa had his sleigh in stealth mode.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I mean, after 9/11 how is it possible that someone can just fly over Manhattan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sightseeing choppers do it all the time. There was this one time, took a midnight loop around the Statue of Liberty with this Latin – – publisher.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: No, he’s right. There’s a Manhattan flight carter which doesn’t require you to radio in if you stay under 1300 feet. My mother-in-law is a licensed pilot, as she keeps reminding me. Part of a larger effort to make me feel inferior. I’m sorry, did I just say that out loud?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sounds like she’s … staying with you, Captain?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: One day soon your in-laws will visit too, and when they do, think hotel. Oh Lord, I hate the holidays.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yet another quality she has in common with the Grinch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if we don’t’ know where our Santa fell from, do we at least know who he is?

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hopefully we will soon. Unis rousted the owner of that boot store in Queens. They’re getting him to open up the shop and check his invoices.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie’s got something for us. Can you keep us posted on the boots?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re taking this on kind of hard, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s a symbol of childhood innocence. Makes me wonder what this means for the future.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It means there’s going to be one less guy being dressed up as Santa. Hey, so uh, we’re coming up on Christmas Eve. Want to keep the tradition going? You, me, a six-pack, Madden on the big screen?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know what? Um … I think Jenny has other plans this year.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Remember how you asked if that fall was what killed him? Well it wasn’t. I pulled this out of his back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that is a .38. Do you still think he fell off his sleigh, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Clearly he was shot out of it. Talk about a war on Christmas.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or he was just shot in an aircraft and pushed out. So we have anything else?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Just this embedded in his suit. A chip of paint or some kind of enamel. Cherry red.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From a sleigh.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I don’t know yet. I’m sending it down to the lab for analysis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably from a sleigh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are we any closer to figuring out who he is?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We are now. Name’s Edmund Smith. Lives in the Bronx. Got his ID from that boot shop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, you just came all the way down her to give me this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah … you told me to keep you posted. You did say that, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Castle and I are gonna go check out the place and see what there is to see.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Mmm. Javi, since when did you wearing cologne to work?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, you know, it’s the holidays and I’ve got places to be, people to see. How about you?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay, I see where this is going. I’m going to stop you right there. I already have plans for Christmas Eve. I’m hanging out with my girlfriends.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh. That’s cool. Maybe afterwards you and I can -

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Javi! Let’s not be one of those sad, desperate holiday hookups. But all this dies down, if you still want to get together, just … give me a call.

utterance.speaker: BETH CABOT
utterance.content: I don’t think he’s home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. Is there a super or someone who can let us into this apartment?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Yeah, um, we have a key. Tim, could you grab Ed’s key? Did uh, something happen to Edmund?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So when was the last time you saw him?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: It must have been last night around 5. I saw him leave with his costume bag. I figured he was going on a job.

utterance.speaker: TIM CABOT
utterance.content: Ed was a professional Santa.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like he took his job pretty seriously.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Oh, he lived it, really. I mean, volunteering at the rec center and the shelter. He was always here for Tim and the kids. He even helped with our lawsuit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was a Santa and a lawyer?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: No. We lost our house and he was just trying to help us out. He was like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like he got involved in a lot of people’s lives. Do you think he made any enemies along the way?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: I didn’t think so, but then last week I heard this man pounding on Ed’s door shouting cuss words.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you see who it was?

utterance.speaker: TIM
utterance.content: I did. I looked out. It was an older, tough looking dude. When he saw me he said, “when you see Ed again tell him that I’ll kill him”. So I told Ed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did he react?

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: He told us not to worry, but you could tell he was pretty shaken up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think you could describe him?

utterance.speaker: TIM
utterance.content: You know what? I – I don’t have to. That’s him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well whoever he is, he’s a pilot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to the tail number on that plane, the Cessna is registered to a David Dunne. Guy’s got priors, too. Drunken disorderly, assault.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where do we find him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well this just lists his place of employment. 1215 Canal Street. 2nd floor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. Someone takes Christmas seriously.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, you should see our place. Our tree is a 15 ft.DouglasFir. We had our garland shipped in from some lake I can’t pronounce by the Canadian border. And wait ‘til you see my train set.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, can’t wait.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re looking for David Dunne.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Oh, Dave’s in the big room teaching a class.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is it you do here, exactly?

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: We make magic.

utterance.speaker: DAVID DUNNE
utterance.content: Again!

utterance.speaker: SANTAS
utterance.content: Ho ho ho!

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: Again!

utterance.speaker: SANTAS
utterance.content: Ho ho ho!

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: Once again, from the diaphragm!

utterance.speaker: SANTAS
utterance.content: Ho ho ho!

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: That’s it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Santa school?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I bet you one Santa is missing.

utterance.speaker: SANTAS
utterance.content: Ho ho ho!

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: This is crazy. I did not kill Edmund.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trust me, you’re going to have to do a lot better than that to convince her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can start by telling us when you last flew your plane.

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: Not for weeks. You can check.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We intend to. Now, where were you at 9:30 last night.

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: I was at the Harlem Youth Center handing out gifts to kids. I wasn’t anywhere near Edmund.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you did engage in some un-Santa-like behavior at his apartment.

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: Is that what this is about? That was nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You threatened to kill him and now he’s dead. I wouldn’t call that nothing.

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: I can explain that, okay? See, Edmund took one of my best gigs. It was a print ad for Cartier. I was their go-to Santa. But this year they wanted to go more warm and cuddly. Look at me. I’m warm, I’m cuddly. But no, they chose Edmund, so yeah, I drank too much peppermint schnapps and went over to his place and popped off. I’m not proud of it. But that was all I did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you see him again after that?

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: No. You have to understand. When I first met Edmund 5 years ago, he was at a low point in life. I raised him up. I taught him everything I knew. I turned him into a world class Santa. And now I’m losing gigs to him? Maybe that’s it. Maybe it’s time to hang up the fluffy red jockstrap.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is – is that a metaphor or do you really –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, when Edmund was killed he was wearing his Santa suit. Do you know if he had a job last night?

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: You’d have to ask his agent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Santas have agents?

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: Yeah. Mostly we use the Bells and Holly Agency.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said Edmund was at a low point in his life. What did you mean by that?

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: I just think he became a Santa to turn his life around. And it worked, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Turn his life around? Was he in trouble of some sort?

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: All I know is back when I met him, Edmund was a totally different guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: David Dunne’s alibi checked out. Harlem Youth Club said that he was there last night and the Cessna’s been parked in a hangar for over a month.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you find out what Santa job Edmund was doing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His agent said he wasn’t booked on any gigs last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why was he wearing his Santa suit and how did he end up dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If this was a story it would all come back to Edmund’s character. Why he became a Santa in the first place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turns out, that’s a mystery all by itself. I’ve been looking into this guy and check it. That is Santa 5 years ago. Meet James Edmund Smith. He was a private equity manager at some big firm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the same guy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dedication to his craft.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like De Niro in Raging Bull.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To be a Santa?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s pretty extreme, I know. And I’ll tell you this much. He didn’t go all Santa for the money. Back in the day he used to pull down half a mil a year. As Santa he made a tenth of that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He made that much as a Santa? Maybe I should switch jobs, huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What, gain 200 pounds and have a bunch of rugrats sitting in your lap with dirty diapers?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, thanks for that visual.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, here’s another thing. I pulled Edmund’s financials. On the night he was killed he withdrew $2 grand from his ATM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He didn’t have that money on him when we found him. His wallet was empty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, take a look at the ATM footage and see if anyone was with him. He might have been robbed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… robbed and then launched into space?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how is that less plausible than your sleigh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think you mean less claus-ible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about his phone records?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Made a bunch of calls to some lawyer in Brooklyn. But here’s the interesting one. The last phone call he ever made was to his ex-wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mrs. Claus.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Gwenn Harwin. I went back pretty far in his phone records. He hasn’t called her for at least 3 years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he pulls out $2 grand, calls his ex-wife, and a couple of hours later he ends up dead. Let’s bring her in.

utterance.speaker: GWENN HARWIN
utterance.content: He called me to say that he wanted to stop by. It was the strangest thing. When he showed up, I didn’t recognize him. He was just … gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry to ask you this, Ms. Harwin, but where were you last night at 9:30?

utterance.speaker: GWENN
utterance.content: It’s quite all right. I understand. I was hosting a benefit for the food bank.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why did Edmund come to see you?

utterance.speaker: GWENN
utterance.content: To apologize.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Apologize for what?

utterance.speaker: GWENN
utterance.content: For the way he walked out on our life. We were good together. At least, I thought we were. Twelve years of marriage, of building a life together, and then five years ago, Christmas Eve, we went to a party and afterwards we stayed up to watch It’s A Wonderful Life. And the next morning he left with just the shirt on his back and no explanation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But why would he visit you now?

utterance.speaker: GWENN
utterance.content: He wanted me to know how sorry he was for the way he left in case … anything happened to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did he mean by that?

utterance.speaker: GWENN
utterance.content: I – I don’t know what he meant. I don’t even know who this man was. He seemed very nervous and very on edge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he give you any indication of what he was afraid of or who might have been after him?

utterance.speaker: GWENN
utterance.content: After he left I went to the window to watch him get to the cab. And as the cab pulled away there was a man on a motorcycle who was following him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re going to need you to give us a description of that motorcycle along with its rider.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Early Christmas present from Jenny?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Something like that. Would you mind … not touching it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oooh. Well, well, well. Now I see what you and Jenny have got planned for Christmas Eve. Ya’ll are gonna be getting busy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ho! Ho! Ho!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Uh … I take it this is your idea of working the Santa case. Detective Esposito, you’re supposed to be digging up that ATM footage. And you are –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Chasing down that lawyer our victim had been calling. Sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, then. Let’s finish up this hoochie-coochie thing and get on with it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, Sir.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So busted.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bow chicha bow bown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How does a guy on a motorcycle connect to Edmund landing in the park?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing connects. Why does a man watch a Christmas movie and then walk out on everything to become Santa? Unless the key to Edmund’s story is It’s A Wonderful Life. You remember in the movie, George Bailey tried to commit suicide on Christmas Eve and was saved by an angel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which in our story is David Dunne.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Weird casting choice, I know. But what if Edmund was trying to jump off a metaphoric bridge? You know, start over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As a Santa?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Yeah, that’s where it falls apart.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, it looks like Edmund was way more than just a Santa. I finally got a hold of that lawyer he’d been calling. She’s actually filed a suit on behalf of his neighbors, the Cabots, who lost their home to a predatory lender, Suncove Funding. Something about illegal practices and forged documents. Anyway, it’s a class action suit representing 43 families with millions of dollars at stake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But why was Edmund calling the lawyer?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She had been working on contingency. She’s already lost tons of money pressing the case so she wanted to drop the suit. But Edmund begged her not to. In fact, he asked her to hold off just a few days, maybe he could turn things around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He didn’t say. But the only thing that would turn things around was a check for $25 grand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we know about this company that Edmund was up against?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Suncove? It’s a fly by night. They made their money and then they folded. Gates actually has a friend at the SEC trying to dig up some information on them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you check with the fraud division, see what they know about Suncove?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, you got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Speaking of It’s A Wonderful Life, I was thinking perhaps tomorrow night we should have a Christmas movie marathon. Or some other kind of marathon that makes life wonderful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look, I know how much the holidays mean to you and how much you love Christmas, but I can’t make it tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The precinct is short staffed, so I’m gonna have to work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How – what – don’t – don’t you have seniority? Don’t – how – how can this happen?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I couldn’t tell Gates. She doesn’t know about us, okay? So … look, I’m sorry. I know that you’re disappointed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, uh … no. It’s not your fault, I know. It’s okay. I’m – I gotta get out of here anyway, got to deal with Alexis and Christmas shopping.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Have fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And don’t get me anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So uh, I pulled this from the ATM footage. Edmund was alone when he took out the cash, but he did get into a cab.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea where he was going?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I traced the taxi using the medallion. Cabbie said he took Edmund to Hohokus Field. It’s a small airfield out in Jersey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that where he got on the plane?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’d think, but no. The cabbie said that Edmund had him wait so he could go meet somebody. Then he got back in the cab, they left the airfield, and the cabbie dropped him off in Long Island City.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t make any sense. How did he end up in the air if he went to Long Island City?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I have no idea. But the person that he met with at the airfield might.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So. You pulled the Christmas shift. Again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know you shouldn’t be eavesdropping, buddy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, does that look cherry red to you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It does.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just like the paint chip we found on Edmund.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This lock’s been tampered with. Looks like it was forced open.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s fresh blood here. And lots of it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like we just found our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like the blood is a match to Edmund, but so far there are no prints. It looks like the cockpit’s been wiped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Edmund came down here and then he went back to Long Island City then how the hell did he end up in this chopper?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well whoever was with him has got to have the answer to that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s start with who owns this thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, according to the airfield manager Mr. Mudge, it belongs to a Chuck Ames. He’s on vacation in Hawaii.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, Mr. Mudge. I’m Kate Beckett. Now, is anyone else authorized to fly that bird?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like just about anybody can have access to this airfield. There’s no checkpoints, no cameras.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The point is, if someone did get on to this property how hard would it be to fly that chopper out of here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then we’re looking for someone who knew the ins and outs of this airport along with the act that that chopper was going to be here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe even someone that knew Chuck Ames would be in Hawaii.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re gonna need Mr. Ames’ contact info, along with all the names of your employees and everyone who’s flown through here in the past year.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and we have a murder to solve. Now, is there any way to know where the chopper flew last night? Is there a flight recorder? GPS system?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have a record of the fuel that was in the tank?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which means we can figure out how far the chopper flew by how much fuel was used. It was down about a fifth of a tank, the R-44 burns about 4 or 5 miles per gallon, so it flew about 45 miles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s almost exactly how far it is to Long Island City and back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Edmund took the cab there and must have gotten in that chopper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s check all the heliports in Long Island City and find out where.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I mean, it’s bad enough that Santa has been murdered. This will be the first Christmas Eve in 18 years we haven’t spent together. I mean, it sets a grim precedent.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, you’re being dramatic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, you can see your friends any time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, what if it’s just one person? And he’s not really just a friend?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, a new guy. Okay. Well, does this non-plural non-friend have a name?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s Max.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Max.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I met him at the annual bad poetry contest right before Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I see. Well, bring him along. I would like to meet this bad poet.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Meet my dad on Christmas Eve?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s – that’s way too much pressure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pressure to what? Eat, drink, and be merry? It’ll be – we –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Max is going to London with his family on Christmas Day. I won’t get to see him until after break. We just want to go ice skating in the park.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, of course. Of course. Go. Have a great time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Besides, you’ll be with Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh! And don’t worry. I’ll be home in bed before Santa comes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, Captain Gates.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yes, what is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just wanted to make sure that you go this before you took off for the holidays.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh. Well thank you, Mr. Castle. I – I’m sorry, I don’t have anything for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please. Just being here each day is a gift. I just wanted to let you know how much I appreciate all that you do. You and Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, I am on my way uptown to meet my mother-in-law to have tea and eat those tiny freaking sandwiches, so why don’t you say what’s on your mind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just so worried about Detective Beckett. I mean, she works so hard. Don’t you think she deserves a little holiday? Isn’t there someone else who could take that Christmas Eve shift?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: First of all, how I schedule my people is not your concern. And having said that, Detective Beckett volunteered to take the shift.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When did she do that?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Earlier today. She came to me and asked to take Detective Eldin’s shift. He has a family and she doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay then. Problem solved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so that narrows it down to five heliports in Long Island City.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: One is a police station, one’s a hospital. They’d both be monitored, so that leaves helipads at Bankcorp Building, One West Hotel, and Case Commerce Building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Case Commerce. The candy canes. Case Commerce, CC. That’s where Edmund was. Let’s find out why.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Castle. You coming?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, you can’t escape it. Christmas is everywhere. So much pressure to have a good time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why wouldn’t I be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Case Commerce. There it is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi. What’s going on here?

utterance.speaker: UNIFORM
utterance.content: A heist occurred at the Christmas party last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A heist?

utterance.speaker: DENISE MCKAY
utterance.content: Well, I – I didn’t notice anything was missing until this morning. And that’s when I called you people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t happen to have a Santa working your party, did you?

utterance.speaker: DENISE
utterance.content: Yes, we did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he look like this?

utterance.speaker: DENISE
utterance.content: Yes. He was our Santa. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like our Santa was a little more naughty than nice.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL CASE
utterance.content: No, I never saw him before last night. And I wasn’t aware he’d stolen anything. But given what we do here, I suppose it could have been a lot worse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what is it that your company does, Mr. Case?

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: Investment services. Asset management, mostly. Given the amount of client and account information we’d be a gold mine for identity thieves. None of those systems were touched.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what did he steal?

utterance.speaker: DENISE
utterance.content: A clock from his office in back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, did you just say clock?

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: Not just any clock, Detective. A Thomas Tillage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. Legendary clockmaker from the restoration period. That must have been a great deal.

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: I had it appraised at $30 thousand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. How big was it?

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: It was about this size.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Small enough to fit in his sack.

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: You know, it’s hard enough imagining one of my guests being a thief, but Santa?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure nothing else is missing?

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: Positive. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well because our evidence suggests that your Santa left by helicopter, which was waiting on you helipad.

utterance.speaker: DENISE
utterance.content: Why would he take a helicopter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t hear anything from the party?

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: No. But the music was loud and the back wall is soundproof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was there anything else that was special about this clock?

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: Not that I’m aware of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’m going to get one of my Detectives to come down and interview your staff. In the meantime, could I have a list of all the party attendees?

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: DENISE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll also pull elevator footage to make sure that there weren’t any uninvited guests.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: $30 thousand. That’s a little more than the Cabots needed for their lawsuit. Maybe our Santa is Robin Hood. Stealing from the rich to give to the poor?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but why would he use a helicopter to steal this? I mean, he could have just stuffed it in his sack and ho ho ho’d his way out of there. It has to be about more than just the clock.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there were a couple more clocks on his workbench. Maybe this one’s significance somehow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. What’s your theory?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … Treasure map inside. No. No, the clock was commissioned by a secret society to count down the end of days. A secret society of Santas, who are the guardians of times. Oh, that’s good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, putting aside the mystery of the helicopter, let’s say it is about the clock. How did Edmund know about it? No one from the office recognized him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well maybe he worked the party before.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sorry, bro. I checked. He hasn’t. But he sure was determined to work it this year. The agency had booked another Santa to work that party but someone from Case Commerce called about a week ago to cancel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me guess. No one actually called from Case?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ding ding.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And when he arrived they assumed he was the Santa they’d hired.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Kind of a brilliant scam, really. You have access to high end homes and businesses. And who’s going to distrust Santa?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … his partners, apparently. No honor among thieves. Even Santa thieves.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, have robbery send that photo to pawn shops and auction houses. If his partners try to cash in, I want to know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Man leaves his life in a high paid job to become the neighborhood saint only to be shot dead after stealing a clock that’s worth less than your average car. And then he gets thrown out of a helicopter that he didn’t even need to be in in the first place. It makes no sense. Given everything that we know about this guy, this is completely out of character.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sometimes people do inexplicable things.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s an explanation for everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is there? You volunteered to take Eldin’s shift. Don’t pretend. If you aren’t ready, why not just tell me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Castle. I didn’t mean to –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t mean to what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Christmas means something different to me than it does to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Christmas. I mean, how can it be different?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, every winter, as soon as that chill rolls in, I’m right back there in that alley. January 9th and we still hadn’t taken our Christmas decorations down. And by the time my dad and I did, it was like we were putting Christmas away forever. We haven’t opened those boxes since.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why every year my dad goes up to his cabin and ever since I became a rookie I have taken the Christmas shift. Because I know that there are families out there that are celebrating together in their homes and I am keeping watch. And that is my tradition. And that is important to me. It’s as important as your tradition is to you. And I’m sorry, Castle. I thought I could let that go, but I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, so I got a custodian that was up on the roof last night for a smoke.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he see anything?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s not what he saw, it’s what he found. Place was cleaned earlier in the day but when he got up there there was trash blown all over the helipad. Probably from the rotor wash when it took off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of trash?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The kind that looked like someone had been waiting for someone. Soda can, candy wrappers, and an empty pouch of pipe tobacco.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pipe tobacco.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now who do we know that smokes a pipe and flies?

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: Now remember, when you go out there, Santa does not enter through the chimney. He enters through the heart.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about through a helicopter?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Put that down.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you crazy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I said put that down!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Merry Christmas to all.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And to all a good night.

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: I already told you where I was and it wasn’t in any helicopter!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, about that. We checked the photos from the Harlem Youth Club. The Santa that was there was not you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you that night, really? Let me help you. I just got off the phone with Chuck Ames, the guy that owns that helicopter, and he said that you’ve rented it from him before.

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: Do I know the guy, so what? You’ve got no proof that I was in that helicopter that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s because you wiped it down when you brought it back but you took something with you, didn’t you? We found this in your apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Care to revise your statement?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me help you again. Edmund figured out a way to make a quick score for you both. He worked the party and you were the getaway flyer. And when he got back into the chopper you decided you wanted it all to yourself.

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: All what? All he had was a damn clock.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not just any clock. A Thomas Tillage worth $30 thousand dollars.

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: That crap is worth $30 grand?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t know that?

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: No, I … And I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Dave. You just admitted to being there.

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: All right, I was there. Ed said he’d pay me $2 grand to fly the chopper to that building, wait while he loaded something on, then take off. And it wasn’t no clock. He wanted to know how much extra weight the chopper could handle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was he planning on taking?

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: For $2 grand I didn’t ask. I just flew the helipad and waited. Then all of a sudden here comes Edmund, running out onto the roof yelling ‘go, go!’. Next thing I know we’re taking fire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone was shooting at you?

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: Hell yeah. They nailed Edmund just as he boarded the chopper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see who it was?

utterance.speaker: DUNNE
utterance.content: No, it was dark. I just cowboy’ed the hell out of there. But poor Ed, I kept yelling to him to ‘close the damn door!’, but when I turned back he was already dead. Chopper banked hard. Before I knew it he was gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well if Dave was telling the truth the shooter was in that building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not just in the building. The only access to the helipad is through Case Commerce, which means our killer was at the party.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, but what was Edmund doing? What was he planning on stealing that weighed so much and why would he take that stupid clock? It makes no sense.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It makes even less sense now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We were running though elevator security footage and we found one person who went up to the party who wasn’t on the guest list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The neighbor kid? Tim Cabot?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And look what he’s holding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A motorcycle helmet. So he was the one that followed Edmund on the motorcycle that night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Kid’s got a record, too. B and E, assault, possession.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but what the hell was he doing there?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I think I may have an answer. Remember that class action suit against Suncove Funding?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: My contact at the SEC dug these up. Suncove’s original articles of incorporation showing the name of the account signatory. Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: James Edmund Smith. The victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Santa is the shark that built those people out of their homes?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He’s got more blood on his hands than that. Tim Cabot’s father died in a car crash. Fell asleep at the wheel working three jobs to pay his inflated mortgage courtesy of Edmund Smith. That was Christmas Eve five years ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The Christmas that Edmund walked out on his life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … it was a tale of redemption. Edmund moves next door to the family whose lives he destroyed, dedicating his life to repairing theirs, never telling themwho he really is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But what if Tim found out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then it’s a very different tale.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Mrs. Cabot. But we need to speak to your son.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your mom doesn’t know, does she? But you do. You knew who he was and how he ruined your lives.

utterance.speaker: TIM
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I knew.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Tim, what –

utterance.speaker: TIM
utterance.content: It was Ed, Mom. He was Suncove, he was the one who bled us dry.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Ed? Our Ed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You must have been pretty angry when you found out.

utterance.speaker: TIM
utterance.content: Hell yeah I was angry. When he told me I wanted to kill him. But I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. He told you?

utterance.speaker: TIM
utterance.content: Yeah. Last week. He asked for my forgiveness and said he wanted to make things right. The lawyer was going to drop the lawsuit but Ed said he couldn’t sit by any more. He knew where there was evidence that could win our case. But he needed my help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of help?

utterance.speaker: TIM
utterance.content: I’m good with locks, all right? He needed me to slip into the party with the wait staff and jimmy open the storage room door in the back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why didn’t you tell us this before?

utterance.speaker: TIM
utterance.content: Because I couldn’t get in trouble again. I need to be here for my mom.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: What was in the storage room?

utterance.speaker: TIM
utterance.content: Files. Boxes of them. Edmund said that they were the original, unaltered loan docs for Suncove. They were the evidence he needed to set things right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One of his old partners must be at Case Commerce. He recognized Edmund and realized he was going after those files.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that’s why he needed the helicopter. He couldn’t exactly cart them out the front door.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And with the cops all over the building it would have been risky for the killer to destroy them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means they’re still there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Along with our killer.

utterance.speaker: DENISE
utterance.content: I tried to stop them but they had a warrant.

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: What the hell is this all about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We were about to ask you the same thing.

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: I’m telling you, I’ve never seen those files in my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then what were they doing in your office storage space, Mr. Case?

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: I don’t have the slightest idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are we really going to play this game, where you deny things that you and I both know are true? Like you telling me didn’t know Edmund? We ran a background check. You and Edmund were business associates. So why would you claim that you didn’t know him? Unless you were hiding something. Like your involvement with Suncove Funding? Did the two of you talk about how much money you could make if you could just bend the rules? How easy it would be to forge documents to put people into mortgages they couldn’t afford? How you could make a quick buck by selling them off to investors.

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: There’s nothing in those files that can implicate me. And nothing to tie me to Suncove Funding or to that man’s death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That clock that was stolen, where did it come from?

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: I’m not sure. I’ll have to ask my decorator.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t bother. We already have documents that prove it belonged to the Cabots.

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: Who are the Cabots?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One of the families whose house you stole. They put that clock up as collateral against a loan and when they couldn’t make the payments Suncove Funding kept it. And that connects you to Suncove.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When you saw Edmund that night you realized he was going after those files because he was going to blow the whistle on Suncove. You knew that Edmund could implicate him, so you killed him.

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: No. You’re wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The US Attorney’s office would freeze your assets. They would seize all of your money. You were going to lose everything. Now, that is motive, that is opportunity, and that is enough for any jury to convict you.

utterance.speaker: CASE
utterance.content: I did not kill Edmund. But I know who did. She was here. She stopped by the party.

utterance.speaker: GWENN
utterance.content: You must be kidding me. Why would I kill him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because he couldn’t live with himself any longer with what he had done. Which meant he was going to take away the one thing that he left you after the divorce. Your lifestyle. Paid for by Suncove profits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He didn’t come to you to apologize that night, did he? He came to warn you, because he knew if he blew the whistle on Suncove you stood to lose everything.

utterance.speaker: GWENN
utterance.content: This is absurd.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You knew everything and you knew why. So you followed him to the rooftop and then you shot him.

utterance.speaker: GWENN
utterance.content: I was at the benefit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know you were at Case Commerce. We have a witness. You killed Edmund.

utterance.speaker: GWENN
utterance.content: When he left me he told me he never wanted to hurt me. That’s what people always say right before they hurt you. Yes, he left me my lifestyle. Five years later he shows up on my doorstep telling me again how he doesn’t want to hurt me. You know what the worst part is? Just for a moment when he stood there that night I was happy to see him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gotta admire the guy. Sacrificed everything to redeem himself. It’s too bad his past caught up with him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Still, those files are on their way to the US Attorney’s Office. Now the Cabots have a real shot at getting back what they lost.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Along with the 42 other families, all because of Edmund.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Speaking of people having their homes stolen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that your mother-in-law again, Sir?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective, if you happen to receive a report of a homicide tonight at my address, do me a favor. Ignore it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, Sir.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well Castle, looks like you might have been right. Maybe there is a Santa Claus after all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whether there’s a Santa Claus or not, that’s not why I love Christmas. When I was a kid, not matter how bad things got, my mother always managed to make Christmas Eve magical. Every year she would put on The Nutcracker Suite. And I thought, if she can do that in our tiny apartment when money was tight and we were alone, it gave me hope that things could get better. And I love that feeling, that sense of hope. It’s crazy, you know. On the shortest, darkest days of the year people of all faiths celebrate the light. Plus, who doesn’t love presents?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um …. Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, what you still doing here? Shouldn’t you be at home, stuffing your wife’s stocking?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t think I’m ready, Javi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: For what? Sex?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. For what sex leads to. We were putting up the tree the other day, and Jenny says to me, “just doesn’t feel like Christmas without kids”. She wants to try. But I come to work. I watch the news every day. It seems like the world’s falling apart. How am I supposed to bring a kid into that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The world’s always falling apart, bro. Since the beginning of time. But having kids? Making a family? That’s what keeps it together. So go home. Make a baby. You’re ready.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks, bro. Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, the glögg is excellent.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And everything looks excellent. Just like always.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Richard. Richard, darling. You don’t have to look so miserable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She’s right, Dad. We know how much this tradition means to you. So we both decided to cancel our plans. We’re here all night. Like always.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love you both so much that you would do that for me. But I was wrong about tonight. There’s some place I need to be.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Go. Go, go, go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – Uh, I was just coming to see you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was coming to see you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about your shift?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I got Karpowski to cover. What about your family tradition?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … I was just thinking it’s time for a new tradition.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh for God's sakes, Richard. Invite the girl in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Would you - ?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s beautiful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t get you anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ms. Cabot? I’m Detective Esposito. I have something that I think belongs to you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We found out that your husband put that up for collateral against the mortgage on your house.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: I haven’t seen this for so long. It was handed down through his family for generations.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think that’s why Edmund took it. He wanted to you to have it back.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BETH
utterance.content: Wait. Why don’t you come inside? We’re just having dinner.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.
